ITEMIZE.label: DEFINITION

ITEM.label: model: Scilab mlist, Scicos model data structure defined by the

ITEMIZE.ITEM: formal name 'model' and containing the following fields:

ITEMIZE.label: FIELDS
ITEMIZE.ITEM: : list(fun,typ) or fun. In the latest case typ is supposed to be 0.
: character string, the name of the block simulation function (a linked C or Fortran procedure or a Scilab function).
: integer, calling sequence type of simulation function (see documentation for more precision).
: column vector of integers, input port sizes indexed from top to bottom of the block. If no input port exist in==[].
: column vector of integers, output port sizes indexed from top to bottom of the block. If no output port exist in==[].
: column vector of ones, the size of evtin gives the number of event input ports. If no event input port exists evtin must be equal to [].
: column vector of ones, the size of evtout gives the number of event output ports. If no event output port exists evtout must be equal to [].
: column vector, the initial continuous state of the block. Must be [] if no continuous state.
: column vector, the initial discrete state of the block. Must be [] if no discrete state.
: column vector, the vector of floating point block parameters. Must be [] if no floating point parameters.
: column vector, the vector of integer block parameters. Must be [] if no integer parameters.
: a character with possible values:
'c' block output depend continuously of the time.
'd' block output changes only on input events.
'z' zero crossing block
'l' logical block

: a vector whose size is equal to the size of evtout> It contains output initial event dates (Events generated before any input event arises). Negative values stands for no initial event on the corresponding port.
: 1x 2 vector of boolean [dep_u, dep_t], dep_u must be true if output depends continuously of the input, dep_t must be true if output depends continuously of the time.
: a character string, used as a label

DESCRIPTION.P: Scicos block model data structure contains all information relative to the simulation functionalities of the block. Fields may be fixed by block definition or set.
If block is a super block, the fields state,dstate,ipar,blocktype,firing, dep_ut, are unused.
The rpar field contains a data structure similar to the scicos_diagram data structure.
